pingball.server

Class Router

  • java.lang.Object
    • pingball.server.Router

  • public class Router
extends java.lang.Object
    A thread-safe mutable routing to keep track of connections between walls. Sockets passed into this class must not be used for outputting data anywhere else. Clients of this class are allowed to read from sockets that are passed in. Representation invariant: The router keeps links of walls of boards to other walls. In order for the system to function correctly (and have valid meaning), these links must be bidirectional. The links in wallLinkMap have to be bidirectional at all times. If a link such as (a, left) -> b is in the wallLinkMap, then the opposite link (b, right) -> a must be present in the map. Thread safety argument: This class is meant to be shared between threads. All methods on router are synchronized, which will guarantee thread safety.

      • addConnectionHorizontal

        public boolean addConnectionHorizontal(java.lang.String left,
                              java.lang.String right)
        Links two boards together horizontally. This breaks any preexisting connections if necessary.
        Parameters:
        left - The left board to link.
        right - The right board to link.
        Returns:
        Whether the boards were successfully linked.

      • addConnectionVertical

        public boolean addConnectionVertical(java.lang.String top,
                            java.lang.String bottom)
        Links two boards together vertically. This breaks any preexisting connections if necessary.
        Parameters:
        top - The top board to link.
        bottom - The bottom board to link.
        Returns:
        Whether the boards were successfully linked.
